meanings.definition: Having a sharp inclination or slope.
meanings.sent1: The hill was the steepest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The mountain path became steeper and steeper as we climbed.
meanings.sent3: The slide at the playground was so steep, it felt like a rollercoaster!
meanings.sent4: Her learning curve was the steepest in the class, but she never gave up.
meanings.sent5: The cliff's edge was the steepest drop imaginable.

meanings.definition: Most extreme or intense in degree.
meanings.sent1: The steepest challenge was completing the marathon in under four hours.
meanings.sent2: His steepest fear was spiders, even the tiniest ones.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the award was so steep, it felt like a battle.
meanings.sent4: The steepest part of the movie was the unexpected plot twist.
meanings.sent5: Her dedication to her work was the steepest among her colleagues.
